parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
AlertConfig carries the value to set into the datastore.
See the documentation on the AlertConfig struct for which fields are required.

parameters.name: key.templateType
parameters.description:
template_type is the enum value to match with the template

 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_HTML: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_HTML is the key of the html template for sent emails
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT is the key of the text template for sent emails
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent slack messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent pushover messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_PAGERDUTY_SUMMARY: TEMPLATE_TYPE_PAGERDUTY_SUMMARY is the key of the summary template for sent pagerduty messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_DISPLAY_NAME: TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_DISPLAY_NAME is the key of the display name template for sent victorops
messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_STATE_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_STATE_MESSAGE is the key of the state message template for sent
victorops messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_GOOGLE_CHAT_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_GOOGLE_CHAT_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Google chat
messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_MICROSOFT_TEAMS_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_MICROSOFT_TEAMS_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Microsoft
teams messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SUBJECT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SUBJECT is the key of the subject line template of a sent email
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for a syslog message part
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_OPSGENIE_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_OPSGENIE_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for a opsgenie alert
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_ZOOM_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_ZOOM_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Zoom messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_HTML: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_HTML is the key of the html template for sent emails when the
single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_TEXT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_TEXT is the key of the text template for sent emails when the
single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_SUBJECT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_SUBJECT is the key of the subject line template of a sent email
when the single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_SINGLE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_SINGLE is the key of the template for webhook message body when the
single_alert option is true
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE is the key of the template for webhook message body when the
single_alert option is false

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value

 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT is the key of the text template for sent emails
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent slack messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent pushover messages

 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE is the key of the template for webhook message body when the

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
TemplateConfig carries the value to set into the datastore.
See the documentation on the TemplateConfig struct for which fields are required.

configurationErrors.title: configuration_errors contain any configuration errors reported by the backend

endpointErrors.title: endpoint_errors contain any failed attempts to send alerts

lastModifiedAt.title: last_modified_at is the time at which the configuration was last modified

lastModifiedBy.title: last_modified_by is the user who last modified the configuration

arista.alert.v1.Alert.title: Alert is the current status of the alert system

settings.title:
settings is the global default settings for various endpoints used in broadcast groups.
Can be overwritten in individual endpoint settings

rules.title: rules define how we route alerts to broadcast groups

broadcastGroups.title: broadcast_groups are groups of endpoints that alerts are sent to

arista.alert.v1.AlertConfig.title: AlertConfig is the configuration for sending alerts

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
AlertConfig instance in this response.

value.description:
Value carries all the values given in the AlertConfigSetRequest as well
as any server-generated values.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==CreatedAt will include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
creation. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each AlertConfig at end.
    * Each AlertConfig response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each AlertConfig at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each AlertConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each AlertConfig at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each AlertConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this AlertConfig's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the AlertConfig value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
Alert instance in this response.

TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each Alert at end.
    * Each Alert response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each Alert at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each Alert response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each Alert at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each Alert response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this Alert's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the Alert value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

clientSecret.title: client_secret is a user generated secret key used for auth

authUri.title:
auth_uri is the URI used for OAuth
this should always be https://login.microsoftonline.com/ unless using a very custom
set up, where the Azure enviroment is not running on microsoft servers

scopes.title: scopes are the scopes that auth is granted for

arista.alert.v1.AzureOAuth.title: AzureOAuth contains the settings for the sending of emails on Azure smtp server

email.title: email is a set of email endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

webhook.title: webhook is a set of webhook endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

slack.title: slack is a set of slack endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

opsgenie.title: opsgenie is a set of opsgenie endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

pushover.title: pushover is a set of pushover endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

pagerduty.title: pagerduty is a set of pagerduty endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

victorops.title: victorops is a set of victorops endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

gchat.title: gchat is a set of google chat endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

msteams.title: msteams is a set of MS teams endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

sendgrid.title: sendgrid is a set of sendgrid endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

syslog.title: syslog is a set of syslog endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

snmp.title: snmp is a set of snmp endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

cueSyslog.title: cue_syslog is a set of cue syslog endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

cueSnmp.title: cue_snmp is a set of cue snmp endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

cueSendgrid.title: cue_sendgrid is a set of cue sendgrid endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

zoom.title: zoom is a set of zoom endpoints to send alerts to as part of this group

arista.alert.v1.BroadcastGroup.title:
BroadcastGroup is a series of endpoints that alerts are sent to if routed there by a rule
No restriction on the number of types of endpoints that can be defined

values.title: values is a map of user defined ids to broadcast groups. No restrictions to naming applies

arista.alert.v1.BroadcastGroups.title: BroadcastGroups is a collection of named broadcast groups

path.title:
path is the 'path' to the invalid config element,
eg: path.userPathName.email_configs[1].to =
the 'to' field of the second email config of the 'userPathName' broadcast_group

errorType.title: error_type is the type of error, this allows custom handling of different error types

error.title: error is a user-friendly error message

arista.alert.v1.ConfigError.title: ConfigError is an error caused by an invalid config being rejected by the backend

arista.alert.v1.ConfigErrorType.description:
- CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_FORMAT: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_FORMAT is caused by invalid format for value (eg: url)
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_SYNTAX: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_SYNTAX is caused by invalid syntax for value (eg: regex)
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_TEMPLATE_INVALID: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_TEMPLATE_INVALID is caused by failure to parse a template
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_ILLEGAL_VALUE: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_ILLEGAL_VALUE is caused by a value outside of its bounds
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_MISSING_REQUIRED: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_MISSING_REQUIRED is caused by a missing required attribute
 - CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_TYPE: CONFIG_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_TYPE is caused by the wrong type found in backing store
arista.alert.v1.ConfigErrorType.title: ConfigErrorType describes the set of possible config error types

values.title: values is a list of errors

arista.alert.v1.ConfigErrors.title: ConfigErrors is a list of configuration-related errors

values.title: values can contain some additional data which is required by the cue specific provider

community.title:
community is the community string used for authentication in SNMPv1 and v2c
required if version < 3

username.title: username the username for SNMPv3 auth

securityLevel.title: security_level the security level for SNMPv3

authenticationProtocol.title:
authentication_protocol is the protocol to use for authentication in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_NO_PRIV/AUTH_PRIV security levels

authenticationPassphrase.title:
authentication_passphrase is the passphrase to use for authentication in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_NO_PRIV/AUTH_PRIV security levels

privacyProtocol.title:
privacy_protocol is the protocol to use for privacy in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_PRIV security level

privacyPassphrase.title:
privacy_passphrase is the passphrase to use for privacy in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_PRIV security level

arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPAuthProtocol.description:
- CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED: CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_MD5: CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_MD5 use the md5 protocol
 - CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA: CUE_SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA use the sha protocol
arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPAuthProtocol.title: CueSNMPAuthProtocol represents the authentication protocol to be used

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the cue snmp global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPEndpoint.title: CueSNMPEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a cue SNMP endpoint

arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPPrivProtocol.description:
- CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED: CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_DES: CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_DES use the des protocol
 - CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES: CUE_SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES use the aes protocol
arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPPrivProtocol.title: CueSNMPPrivProtocol represents the privacy protocol to be used

target.title: target is an ipv4 address to send messages to

port.title: port is the network port to target

transport.title: transport is the transport protocol to use ("udp" or "tcp"); if unset "udp" will be used

version.title: version is the SNMP version, v2c and v3 are supported and can be set with 2 and 3 respectively

auth.title: auth is the optional authentication settings

data.title: data is additional data that maybe required for constructing the message or sending it

arista.alert.v1.CueSNMPSettings.title: CueSNMPSettings contain the settings for sending cue alerts with SNMP

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

to.title: to address to send email to

httpOverride.title:
http_override is the override of the global http settings
This overrides the value used in Settings message in the global alert config

arista.alert.v1.CueSendgridEndpoint.title: CueSendgridEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a cue sendgrid endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.CueSendgridEndpoints.title: CueSendgridEndpoints is a set of cue sendgrid endpoints

apiKey.title: api_key is the key used to connect to the sendgrid APIs

from.title: from is the sender's address in the email sent

arista.alert.v1.CueSendgridSettings.title: CueSendgridSettings contain the settings for sending cue alerts to sendgrid

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.CueSnmpEndpoints.title: CueSnmpEndpoints is a set of cue SNMP endpoints

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the cue syslog global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.CueSyslogEndpoint.title: CueSyslogEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a cue syslog endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.CueSyslogEndpoints.title: CueSyslogEndpoints is a set of cue syslog endpoints

arista.alert.v1.CueSyslogMessageFormat.description:
- CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_UNSPECIFIED: CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_PLAIN: CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_PLAIN format uses the text format for constructing the syslog message
 - CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_IDMEF: CUE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE_FORMAT_IDMEF uses IDMEF message format as described here:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4765
arista.alert.v1.CueSyslogMessageFormat.title: CueSyslogMessageFormat is the message format for cue syslog messages

network.title:
network is the network protocol to use, default is "udp",
options also include: tcp,tcp4,tcp6,udp4,udp6

address.title: address is the ip address to send syslog messages to

port.title: port is server's port to connect to

messageFormat.title: message_format defines the message format to use

appendBomHeader.description:
append_bom_header if true a BOM( Byte Order Mark ) will be appended to the outgoing message
BOM will tell the server that is receiving the messages, that the format is UTF8.

data.title: data is additional data that maybe required for constructing the message or sending it

arista.alert.v1.CueSyslogSettings.title: CueSyslogSettings contain the settings for sending alerts with syslog for cue

key.title: key identifies which template the configuration is for

template.title:
template is the string template value to be used
Templates need to be compatible with their respective parsers
Message templates are read and parsed by https://golang.org/pkg/text/template/
Html templates are read and parsed by https://golang.org/pkg/html/template/
Templates must output valid JSON for certain templates
Templates must not fail for any valid input

multiAlert.description:
multi_alert is true if this template uses a multiple alert context and false if a single
alert context is used.

description.description: description is a description of the template.

externalDocumentation.description:
external_documentation is a url to any relevant external documentation, or "" if there is no
relevant documentation.

outputFormat.description:
output_format is the expected output format of this template
Any submitted template will be expected to output text with valid formatting for any input or
may fail validation.

displayName.title: display_name is the name that can be displayed to the user for this particular template type

arista.alert.v1.DefaultTemplate.title: DefaultTemplate is the system default template which is used when no user template has been set

responses.description:
Values are the values deemed relevant to the initiating request.
The length of this structure is guaranteed to be between (inclusive) 1 and 
min(req.max_messages, INTERNAL_BATCH_LIMIT).

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
DefaultTemplate instance in this response.

Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

error.description:
Error is an optional field.
It should be filled when there is an error in the GetSome process.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each DefaultTemplate at end.
    * Each DefaultTemplate response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each DefaultTemplate at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each DefaultTemplate response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each DefaultTemplate at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each DefaultTemplate response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this DefaultTemplate's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the DefaultTemplate value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

to.description:
Email does not have a http override
 Email does not have a settings override
to.title: to address to send email to

arista.alert.v1.EmailEndpoint.title: EmailEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to an email endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.EmailEndpoints.title: EmailEndpoints is a set of email endpoints

from.title: from is the email address to send from

smarthost.title: smarthost is the hostname and port of the SMTP server

authUsername.title:
auth_username the username to use when sending emails
required for all auth methods

authPassword.title: auth_password the password to use when sending emails

requireTls.title: require_tls always use TLS connections when sending emails

singleAlertPerEmail.title:
single_alert_per_email configures the Alerter such that each alert generates a separate email
notification, the email will only have a single notification, the format will also be different

azureOAuth.title:
azure_o_auth used for auth when using an Azure smtp server
uses auth_username, scopes is not required as we use https://outlook.office365.com/.default

arista.alert.v1.EmailSettings.title: EmailSettings contain the settings for the sending of emails

endpointType.title:
endpoint_type indicates the type of endpoint which failed,
or unknown if not endpoint-specific (eg: slack, opsgenie)

broadcastGroupName.title:
broadcast_group_name is the name of the broadcast group which was being used,
empty string if not group specific

configIndex.description:
config_index is the index of the config on the broadcast group or -1 if not applicable
eg: if there are two email config in one broadcast group, then the indices for each are 0 and 1
note that these are done per type, so only counting email/slack/...

errorType.title: error_type is the type of error, this allows custom handling of different error types

error.title: error is a user-friendly error message

arista.alert.v1.EndpointError.title: EndpointError is an error caused by a failure to send alert(s) for any reason

arista.alert.v1.EndpointErrorType.description:
- ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_HTTP_POST_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_HTTP_POST_ERROR an error in sending HTTP request or reading a HTTP
response
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_JSON_MARSHAL_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_JSON_MARSHAL_ERROR is caused by errors while encoding json
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_CONFIG_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_INVALID_CONFIG_ERROR is an error caused by invalid config (missing,
bad format, etc)
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_TEMPLATE_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_TEMPLATE_ERROR is caused by errors while executing templates
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_BAD_RESPONSE_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_BAD_RESPONSE_ERROR is caused by receiving a negative response from an
endpoint indicating that the alert was not sent
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_SMTP_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_SMTP_ERROR is caused by errors with SMTP
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_CONNECTION_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_CONNECTION_ERROR is caused by errors with a connection
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_TIMEOUT_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_TIMEOUT_ERROR is caused by errors with a connection
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_RATE_LIMIT_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_RATE_LIMIT_ERROR is caused by an Alerter rate limit being exceeded
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_ALERT_CAP_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_ALERT_CAP_ERROR is caused by the number of alerts sent to a sender
exceeding the built-in limit
 - ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_O_AUTH_ERROR: ENDPOINT_ERROR_TYPE_O_AUTH_ERROR is caused when we failed authenticating using the
OAuth apis
arista.alert.v1.EndpointErrorType.title: EndpointErrorType describe the set of possible endpoint types

values.title: values is the list of errors

arista.alert.v1.EndpointErrors.title: EndpointErrors is a set of errors related to sending of alerts

arista.alert.v1.EventList.title: EventList is a list of event types

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

httpOverride.title: http_override is the override of the global http settings

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the google chat global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.GoogleChatEndpoint.title: GoogleChatEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a google chat endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.GoogleChatEndpoints.title: GoogleChatEndpoints is a set of googleChat endpoints

url.title: url is the url of the webhook to send alerts to

arista.alert.v1.GoogleChatSettings.title: GoogleChatSettings contain the settings for sending alerts to google chat

values.title: values is the header values

arista.alert.v1.HeaderValues.title: HeaderValues is a set of values for this header

values.title: values is a map of http header names to values

arista.alert.v1.HttpHeaders.title: HttpHeaders is a set of http headers

username.title: username is the username to use when connecting to the http proxy

password.title: password is the password to use when connecting to the http proxy

proxyUrl.title: proxy_url is the url for the http proxy

customHeaders.title: custom_headers is custom http headers to be used along with the default headers

arista.alert.v1.HttpSettings.title: HttpSettings are the settings to be used when sending various message over a http connection

values.title:
values is a map where the keys are event type which when active will suppress any events with
event types in the related EventList

arista.alert.v1.InhibitionSettings.title: InhibitionSettings allows certain event types to be suppressed while other event types are active

severities.title:
severities is a list of severities to filter on,
if an event does not have one of these severities, it will not match
Valid values are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR and CRITICAL

devices.title:
devices is a list of device IDs to filter on,
if an event does not belong to one of these devices, it will not match

eventTypes.title:
event_types is a list of event types to filter on,
if an event does not have one of these event types, it will not match

deviceTags.title: device_tags is a string tag query that is used to match on the event's device tags

intfTags.title: intf_tags is a string tag query that is used to match on the event's interface tags

ruleIds.title:
rule_ids is a list of rule IDs to filter on,
if an event does not have one of these rule IDs, it will not match

arista.alert.v1.Matches.title:
Matches is a set of restrictions that must be satisfied for a rule to be matched
Empty fields are ignored for matching purposes. Condition contents are
OR'd and then AND'd with the other criteria

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of the last item included in the metadata calculation.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

count.description: Count is the number of items present under the conditions of the request.

routingKey.title: routing_key is the routing key for sending pagerduty alerts

httpOverride.title: http_override is the override of the global http settings

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the pagerduty global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.PagerdutyEndpoint.title: PagerdutyEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a pagerduty endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.PagerdutyEndpoints.title: PagerdutyEndpoints is a set of pagerduty endpoints

arista.alert.v1.Priorities.title: Priorities is a mapping of CV event severities to syslog severities

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

token.title: token is the user's registered application's API token, see https://pushover.net/apps

userKey.title: user_key is the user's user key

httpOverride.description: Pushover does not have a settings override
httpOverride.title: http_override is the override of the global http settings

arista.alert.v1.PushoverEndpoint.title: PushoverEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a pushover endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.PushoverEndpoints.title: PushoverEndpoints is a set of pushover endpoints

sendsTo.title: sends_to is the name of the broadcast group top send matching alerts to

matchCriteria.title: match_criteria is the criteria that an alert must match to be sent to the broadcast group

continueChecks.title:
continue_checks if true, causes alerts matching this rule's criteria to continue
checking against other rules, allowing for additional matches. If false,
alerts matching this rule will not proceed with checking

comment.title: comment is a comment to include that will be displayed in the alert

suppressFor.title: suppress_for is a time duration that a rule will be debounced for after being called

arista.alert.v1.Rule.title: Rule is a rule to send to a certain broadcast group

values.title: values contains the rules

arista.alert.v1.Rules.title: Rules is a list of rules which dictates which events generate alerts for which broadcast groups

community.title:
community is the community string used for authentication in SNMPv1 and v2c
required if version < 3

username.title: username the username for SNMPv3 auth

securityLevel.title: security_level the security level for SNMPv3

authenticationProtocol.title:
authentication_protocol is the protocol to use for authentication in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_NO_PRIV/AUTH_PRIV security levels

authenticationPassphrase.title:
authentication_passphrase is the passphrase to use for authentication in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_NO_PRIV/AUTH_PRIV security levels

privacyProtocol.title:
privacy_protocol is the protocol to use for privacy in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_PRIV security level

privacyPassphrase.title:
privacy_passphrase is the passphrase to use for privacy in SNMPv3
required for AUTH_PRIV security level

arista.alert.v1.SNMPAuth.title: SNMPAuth contain authentication information for SNMP

arista.alert.v1.SNMPAuthProtocol.description:
- SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_MD5: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_MD5 use the md5 protocol
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA use the sha protocol
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_224: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_224 use the sha224 protocol
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_256: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_256 use the sha256 protocol
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_384: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_384 use the sha384 protocol
 - SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_512: SNMP_AUTH_PROTOCOL_SHA_512 use the sha512 protocol
arista.alert.v1.SNMPAuthProtocol.title: SNMPAuthProtocol represents the authentication protocol to be used

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the microsoft teams global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.SNMPEndpoint.title: SNMPEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to an SNMP endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.SNMPEndpoints.title: SNMPEndpoints is a set of SNMP endpoints

arista.alert.v1.SNMPPrivProtocol.description:
- SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_DES: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_DES use the des protocol
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES use the aes protocol
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_192: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_192 use the aes192 protocol
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_256: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_256 use the aes256 protocol
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_192C: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_192C use the aes192c protocol
 - SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_256C: SNMP_PRIV_PROTOCOL_AES_256C use the aes256c protocol
arista.alert.v1.SNMPPrivProtocol.title: SNMPPrivProtocol represents the privacy protocol to be used

arista.alert.v1.SNMPSecurityLevel.description:
- SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED: SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_NO_AUTH_NO_PRIV: SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_NO_AUTH_NO_PRIV use no security
 - SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_AUTH_NO_PRIV: SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_AUTH_NO_PRIV use authentication without privacy
 - SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_AUTH_PRIV: SNMP_SECURITY_LEVEL_AUTH_PRIV use both authentication and privacy
arista.alert.v1.SNMPSecurityLevel.title: SNMPSecurityLevel indicates what level of security should be used

target.title: target is an ipv4 address to send messages to

port.title: port is the network port to target

transport.title: transport is the transport protocol to use ("udp" or "tcp"); if unset "udp" will be used

version.title:
version is the SNMP version, v1, v2c and v3 are supported and can be set
with 1, 2 and 3 respectively

engineId.title:
engine_id is the engine ID that will be used by the Alerter
This should be a hexadecimal string, colon separators between bytes will be accepted when
writing, but will be absent when reading
optional: if excluded or left blank, this will be automatically generated

arista.alert.v1.SNMPSettings.title: SNMPSettings contain the settings for sending alerts with SNMP

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

to.title: to address to send email to

httpOverride.title: http_override is the override of the global http settings

arista.alert.v1.SendgridEndpoint.title: SendgridEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a sendgrid endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.SendgridEndpoints.title: SendgridEndpoints is a set of sendgrid endpoints

apiKey.title: api_key is the api key to use

from.title: from is the email address to send from

arista.alert.v1.SendgridSettings.title: SendgridSettings contain the settings for sending emails via sendgrid

email.title: email is the global default settings for email

http.title: http is the global default settings for http

slack.title: slack is the global default settings for slack

victorops.title: victorops is the global default settings for victorops

pagerduty.title: pagerduty is the global default settings for pagerduty

opsgenie.title: opsgenie is the global default settings for opsgenie

gchat.title: gchat is the global default settings for google chat

msteams.title: msteams is the global default settings for ms teams

inhibition.title:
inhibition defines the inhibition rules for alerts, allowing events of certain types to be
suppressed while another event type is active

baseUrl.description: base_url is the root address of your CloudVision app. Used to generate links in notifications.

timezone.title: timezone is used for formatting event times in notifications. E.g. 'UTC', 'US/Pacific'

syslog.title: syslog is the global default settings for syslog

snmp.title: snmp is the global default settings for snmp

sendgrid.title: sendgrid is the global default settings for sendgrid

cueSyslog.title: cue_syslog is the global default settings for cue syslog

cueSnmp.title: cue_snmp is the global default settings for cue snmp

cueSendgrid.title: cue_sendgrid is the global default settings for cue sendgrid

hideTags.title:
hide_tags is used to by the alerting system to omit tags and other "superfluous"
values from the notifications that are sent out by the system

zoom.title: zoom is the global default settings for zoom

webhook.title: webhook is the auth settings for webhook

arista.alert.v1.Settings.title: Settings portion of config, a list of default global settings used by broadcast groups

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the slack global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.SlackEndpoint.title: SlackEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a slack endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.SlackEndpoints.title: SlackEndpoints is a set of slack endpoints

url.title: url is the url of the slack webhook to use

arista.alert.v1.SlackSettings.title: SlackSettings contain the settings for sending alerts to slack

sendResolved.title: send_resolved send alerts when events are resolved along with when they are triggered

settingsOverride.title: settings_override is the override for the microsoft teams global endpoint settings

arista.alert.v1.SyslogEndpoint.title: SyslogEndpoint contains the required information for an alert to be sent to a syslog endpoint

values.title: values are the elements of the set

arista.alert.v1.SyslogEndpoints.title: SyslogEndpoints is a set of syslog endpoints

network.title:
network is the network protocol to use, default is "udp",
options also include: tcp,tcp4,tcp6,udp4,udp6

address.title: address is the network address to send syslog messages to

facility.title: facility is the syslog facility 0-23 inc. This is the syslog facility as defined in RFC-3164

priorities.title:
priorities describes how CVP severity maps to syslog priority
priority is a number between 0-7 inc. as defined in RFC-3164

tag.title: tag is the syslog TAG as described in RFC-3164, it is the prefix to all syslog messages

perDevice.title:
per_device allows message to optionally be sent per device,
if an event concerns two devices the behaviour is changed based on this option:
  true: two messages are sent, one for each device
  false: a single message is sent

useTls.title: use_tls determines if the connection to the server should be secured with TLS

arista.alert.v1.SyslogSettings.title: SyslogSettings contain the settings for sending alerts with syslog

key.title: key identifies which template the configuration is for

template.title:
template is the string template value to be used
Templates need to be compatible with their respective parsers
Message templates are read and parsed by https://golang.org/pkg/text/template/
Html templates are read and parsed by https://golang.org/pkg/html/template/
Templates must output valid JSON for certain templates
Templates must not fail for any valid input

responses.description:
Values are the values deemed relevant to the initiating request.
The length of this structure is guaranteed to be between (inclusive) 1 and 
min(req.max_messages, INTERNAL_BATCH_LIMIT).

type.description:
This describes the class of delete error.
A DeleteAllResponse is only sent when there is an error.

error.description: This indicates the error message from the delete failure.

key.description: This is the key of the TemplateConfig instance that failed to be deleted.

time.description: Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp when the key was being deleted.

key.description: Key echoes back the key of the deleted TemplateConfig instance.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==DeletedAt will not include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
deletion. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

keys.title: key contains a list of TemplateConfig keys to delete

arista.alert.v1.TemplateConfigDeleteSome.description: TemplateConfigDeleteSomeResponse is only sent when there is an error.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
TemplateConfig instance in this response.

value.description:
Value carries all the values given in the TemplateConfigSetRequest as well
as any server-generated values.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==CreatedAt will include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
creation. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

values.description:
value contains a list of TemplateConfig values to write.
It is possible to provide more values than can fit within either:
    - the maxiumum send size of the client
    - the maximum receive size of the server
If this error occurs you must reduce the number of values sent.
See gRPC "maximum message size" documentation for more information.

time.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

error.description:
Error is an optional field.
It should be filled when there is an error in the GetSome process.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each TemplateConfig at end.
    * Each TemplateConfig response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each TemplateConfig at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each TemplateConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each TemplateConfig at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each TemplateConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this TemplateConfig's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the TemplateConfig value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

templateType.title: template_type is the enum value to match with the template

arista.alert.v1.TemplateKey.title: TemplateKey is used to identify templates for event notifications

arista.alert.v1.TemplateOutput.description:
- TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_UNSPECIFIED: TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecfied value.
 - TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_TEXT: TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_TEXT indicates the the template outputs plain text.
 - TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_JSON: TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_JSON indicates the the template outputs JSON.
 - TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_HTML: TEMPLATE_OUTPUT_HTML indicates the the template outputs HTML.
This also indicates that "html/templates" will be used instead of "text/templates" so that
html characters are automatically escaped from input.
arista.alert.v1.TemplateOutput.title: TemplateOutput is an enum of all of the possible output formats for templates

arista.alert.v1.TemplateType.description:
- TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: TEMPLATE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the unspecified enum value
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_HTML: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_HTML is the key of the html template for sent emails
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_TEXT is the key of the text template for sent emails
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_SLACK_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent slack messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_PUSHOVER_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent pushover messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_PAGERDUTY_SUMMARY: TEMPLATE_TYPE_PAGERDUTY_SUMMARY is the key of the summary template for sent pagerduty messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_DISPLAY_NAME: TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_DISPLAY_NAME is the key of the display name template for sent victorops
messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_STATE_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_VICTOROPS_STATE_MESSAGE is the key of the state message template for sent
victorops messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_GOOGLE_CHAT_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_GOOGLE_CHAT_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Google chat
messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_MICROSOFT_TEAMS_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_MICROSOFT_TEAMS_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Microsoft
teams messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SUBJECT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SUBJECT is the key of the subject line template of a sent email
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_SYSLOG_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for a syslog message part
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_OPSGENIE_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_OPSGENIE_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for a opsgenie alert
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_ZOOM_MESSAGE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_ZOOM_MESSAGE is the key of the message template for sent Zoom messages
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_HTML: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_HTML is the key of the html template for sent emails when the
single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_TEXT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_TEXT is the key of the text template for sent emails when the
single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_SUBJECT: TEMPLATE_TYPE_EMAIL_SINGLE_SUBJECT is the key of the subject line template of a sent email
when the single alert per email option is selected
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_SINGLE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_SINGLE is the key of the template for webhook message body when the
single_alert option is true
 - TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE: TEMPLATE_TYPE_WEBHOOK_MULTIPLE is the key of the template for webhook message body when the
single_alert option is false
arista.alert.v1.TemplateType.title: TemplateType describes the types of Templates that are usable

simpleOutput.description:
simple_output is a boolean flag to control the JSON structure of the webhook body.
When false the output mimics the old alertmanager format.
When true the output is a simple array of json objects which each represent an event.

singleAlert.description:
single_alert is a boolean flag that will cause an individual webhook message to be sent per
alert when true.

azure_o_auth used for auth when using an Azure smtp server
uses auth_username

verificationToken.title: verification_token is the verification token to authenticate with

arista.subscriptions.Operation.description:
- INITIAL: INITIAL indicates the associated notification is that of the
current state and a fully-specified Resource is provided.
 - INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE: INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE indicates all existing-state has been
streamed to the client. This status will be sent in an
otherwise-empty message and no subsequent INITIAL messages
should be expected.
 - UPDATED: UPDATED indicates the associated notification carries
modification to the last-streamed state. This indicates
the contained Resource may be a partial diff, though, it
may contain a fully-specified Resource.
 - DELETED: DETLETED indicates the associated notification carries
a deletion. The Resource's key will always be set in this case,
but no other fields should be expected.

fmp.DeleteError.description:
DeleteError defines the set of delete error types.

 - DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED indicates that the delete error
is not specified.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED: DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED indicates that the user is not authorized
to perform the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL: DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL indicates that the server encountered an
unrecoverable error on the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY: DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY indicates that the specified error is
not allowed by the service.
